reviews.review_msg: One of the greatest profs I have ever met at SFU. This 380W class was really fascinating if you have a moderate interest in history. The algebraic and geometric questions are fairly straightforward like high-school level. It's an upper-level writing course but Tom does not require you to have that advanced writing skills, which is nice for us.

As a professor, Tom really changed my life. His course made me realize my strengths in math and he is very accommodating and encouraging. He cares about his students and that really made me respect him. The course requires some strong writing skills, unlike most math classes, but Tom is always there to help. Thank you, Tom.

Math 380 is really hard, so buckle up. However, Tom really cares about his students so if you can make it through the innumerable assignments and difficult exams you'll come out with a newfound respect for mathematics. He also takes the time to try and learn his student's names, which I thought was important at the university level. A great guy!
ONE OF THE BEST PROF IN SFU I EVER HAD. IT'S WORTH TO TAKE HIS CLASS. REALLY CARES ABOUT STUDENT, GIVE EXTRA HELP. ALTHOUGH THE CLASS IS NOT EASY, BUT YOU WILL SURVIVE AND ACTUALLY LEARN SOMETHING.

Great professor. He's understanding, accommodating and helpful (very accessible for extra help!)... Takes the time to remember every students name, which reflects his dedication to his class and students.
Very caring prof! Would def take another course with him. The W  (writing) was frustrating at times though...Assignments were weighed quite heavily and tough at times.

useless prof... never post notes or even assignment solution on webct... not due to busy or what... but as he said "he would never do additional things that aren't get paid"... boring lectures but you must attend.. otherwise you would miss the assignment due date... this prof does change midterm day... without sending you an email... irresponsible
